explanation: Encodes CD138, a canonical plasma cell surface marker.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific plasma cell markers (SDC1/CD138, JCHAIN, MZB1, SLAMF7, CD38) are present, strongly supporting the annotation.

explanation: Immunoglobulin J chain, highly expressed in antibody-secreting plasma cells.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific plasma cell markers (SDC1/CD138, JCHAIN, MZB1, SLAMF7, CD38) are present, strongly supporting the annotation.

explanation: Chaperone involved in immunoglobulin secretion, specific to plasma cells.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific plasma cell markers (SDC1/CD138, JCHAIN, MZB1, SLAMF7, CD38) are present, strongly supporting the annotation.

explanation: Surface protein enriched in plasma cells and used for their identification.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific plasma cell markers (SDC1/CD138, JCHAIN, MZB1, SLAMF7, CD38) are present, strongly supporting the annotation.

explanation: Highly expressed on plasma cells, used as a diagnostic marker.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific plasma cell markers (SDC1/CD138, JCHAIN, MZB1, SLAMF7, CD38) are present, strongly supporting the annotation.

explanation: Highly expressed in epithelial cells and a canonical marker for epithelial and carcinoma cells.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific epithelial and colorectal cancer-associated markers (EPCAM, MUC13, PROM1, SPINK1, FABP6) are present, strongly supporting tumor epithelial cell identity.

explanation: Mucin gene upregulated in colorectal cancer epithelial cells.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific epithelial and colorectal cancer-associated markers (EPCAM, MUC13, PROM1, SPINK1, FABP6) are present, strongly supporting tumor epithelial cell identity.

explanation: Also known as CD133, a marker of cancer stem-like epithelial cells in CRC.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific epithelial and colorectal cancer-associated markers (EPCAM, MUC13, PROM1, SPINK1, FABP6) are present, strongly supporting tumor epithelial cell identity.

explanation: Overexpressed in colorectal and other epithelial cancers.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific epithelial and colorectal cancer-associated markers (EPCAM, MUC13, PROM1, SPINK1, FABP6) are present, strongly supporting tumor epithelial cell identity.

explanation: Expressed in intestinal epithelial cells, especially in the ileum and CRC.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific epithelial and colorectal cancer-associated markers (EPCAM, MUC13, PROM1, SPINK1, FABP6) are present, strongly supporting tumor epithelial cell identity.

explanation: Highly specific for mast cells, encodes carboxypeptidase A3, a classic mast cell protease.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific mast cell markers (CPA3, HPGDS, LTC4S, RGS13) are present, strongly supporting mast cell identity in CRC tissue.

explanation: Enzyme involved in prostaglandin D2 synthesis, highly expressed in mast cells.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific mast cell markers (CPA3, HPGDS, LTC4S, RGS13) are present, strongly supporting mast cell identity in CRC tissue.

explanation: Leukotriene C4 synthase, key enzyme in mast cell eicosanoid metabolism.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific mast cell markers (CPA3, HPGDS, LTC4S, RGS13) are present, strongly supporting mast cell identity in CRC tissue.

explanation: Regulator of G-protein signaling, selectively expressed in mast cells.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific mast cell markers (CPA3, HPGDS, LTC4S, RGS13) are present, strongly supporting mast cell identity in CRC tissue.

explanation: Transcription factor important for mast cell development and maintenance.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific mast cell markers (CPA3, HPGDS, LTC4S, RGS13) are present, strongly supporting mast cell identity in CRC tissue.

explanation: Highly specific for macrophages, especially tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs) in CRC.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific macrophage/TAM markers (CSF1R, C1QA, AIF1, CD14, FCGR3A) are present, strongly supporting the annotation in the CRC context.

explanation: Classical macrophage marker, part of the complement system, enriched in TAMs.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific macrophage/TAM markers (CSF1R, C1QA, AIF1, CD14, FCGR3A) are present, strongly supporting the annotation in the CRC context.

explanation: Also known as IBA1, a well-known macrophage marker.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific macrophage/TAM markers (CSF1R, C1QA, AIF1, CD14, FCGR3A) are present, strongly supporting the annotation in the CRC context.

explanation: Monocyte/macrophage marker, involved in innate immune response.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific macrophage/TAM markers (CSF1R, C1QA, AIF1, CD14, FCGR3A) are present, strongly supporting the annotation in the CRC context.

explanation: Expressed in macrophages, especially those with an activated phenotype in tumors.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific macrophage/TAM markers (CSF1R, C1QA, AIF1, CD14, FCGR3A) are present, strongly supporting the annotation in the CRC context.

explanation: A canonical marker for fibroblasts and CAFs, especially in the tumor microenvironment.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific CAF/fibroblast markers (PDGFRA, PDGFRB, COL3A1) are present, strongly supporting CAF identity in CRC.

explanation: Frequently expressed in activated fibroblasts/CAFs, involved in stromal remodeling.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific CAF/fibroblast markers (PDGFRA, PDGFRB, COL3A1) are present, strongly supporting CAF identity in CRC.

explanation: Encodes type III collagen, a major ECM component produced by fibroblasts.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific CAF/fibroblast markers (PDGFRA, PDGFRB, COL3A1) are present, strongly supporting CAF identity in CRC.

explanation: Matrix metalloproteinase involved in ECM remodeling, characteristic of activated fibroblasts.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific CAF/fibroblast markers (PDGFRA, PDGFRB, COL3A1) are present, strongly supporting CAF identity in CRC.

explanation: Extracellular matrix protein, enriched in fibroblasts.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific CAF/fibroblast markers (PDGFRA, PDGFRB, COL3A1) are present, strongly supporting CAF identity in CRC.

explanation: Encodes the CD8 alpha chain, a definitive marker of cytotoxic T lymphocytes.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific markers for CD8+ T cells (CD8A, GZMA, CD2, CD247, TIGIT) are present, strongly supporting this annotation in the CRC context.

explanation: Granzyme A is a cytotoxic molecule expressed in activated CD8+ T cells.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific markers for CD8+ T cells (CD8A, GZMA, CD2, CD247, TIGIT) are present, strongly supporting this annotation in the CRC context.

explanation: A pan-T cell marker, present on all mature T cells.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific markers for CD8+ T cells (CD8A, GZMA, CD2, CD247, TIGIT) are present, strongly supporting this annotation in the CRC context.

explanation: Component of the T cell receptor-CD3 complex, specific to T cells.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific markers for CD8+ T cells (CD8A, GZMA, CD2, CD247, TIGIT) are present, strongly supporting this annotation in the CRC context.

explanation: An immune checkpoint receptor highly expressed on activated and exhausted T cells, including CD8+ subsets.
evidence_reason: Multiple highly specific markers for CD8+ T cells (CD8A, GZMA, CD2, CD247, TIGIT) are present, strongly supporting this annotation in the CRC context.
